data.title: Sapulpa basketball may be moving up to 6A
data.meta_description: See where Sapulpa and other high schools land in the OSSAA's 2024-25 Average Daily Membership report that will determine classifications for the upcoming school year.
data.text:
Barry Lewis

Tulsa World College & High School Sports Editor

Get email notifications on {{subject}} daily!

Don't have an account? Sign Up Today

Perennial girls basketball power Sapulpa could be moving up to Class 6A for the upcoming season.

Sapulpa, which has won two 5A state titles in the past four years and was a runner-up in 2024, will be in 6A for the first time since qualifying for the 2020 state tournament, if the Oklahoma Secondary School Activities Association’s 2024-25 Average Daily Membership tentative report is approved.

Schools have until Thursday afternoon to report any discrepancies that could affect the report. A vote on the ADM is expected at next week’s board meeting.

Sapulpa is currently at No. 32 in the ADM and if that holds it will be in 6A while Lawton drops from 6A to 5A.

The ADM determines classifications for basketball and several other sports for the upcoming school year. Football and softball for the 2024 season, and baseball and soccer for 2025 are are not affected by the 2024-25 ADM.

Sapulpa football already moved up from 5A to 6AII for the next two seasons based on the updated 2023-24 ADM.

OSSAA ADM 2024-25 (Tentative)
